results.title: Airborne
results.creator_credit: Chris Dillon, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Explores the rugged inaccessible country where deer can be found. It contains thrilling sequences of low level flight over spectacularly beautiful unexplored terrain, and culminates in the excitement of a live deer capture.

results.title: Air pollution: a first film
results.creator_credit: Norman Bean and Norman Bean Films
results.brief_description: This film explains that almost all of man’s activities can contribute to air pollution. It outlines the problems associated with air pollution and indicates that everyone must share in correcting pollution problems. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Air links of the world. No. 6. Southern Cross route
results.creator_credit: Jean Halliday, Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Shows the air route between Australia and America pioneered by Kingsford-Smith in the Southern Cross. An Australian family flies from Australia to the USA. Maps and scenes of route and places visited including Fiji, Canton Island, Hawaii to San Francisco.

results.title: Aida
results.brief_description: This production of Verdi’s much-loved masterpiece was a triumphant success when it opened at La Scala in December, 1985 and Luciano Pavarotti’s long awaited performance as Radames was greeted with rapturous applause. In this live recording of that production Pavrotti heads an exceptional cast, with Ghena Dimitrova, Maria Chiara, Nicolai Ghiaurov and Juan Pons, all in peak form. Lorin Maazel conducts the Orchestra of La Scala, Milan. Rated: G

results.title: Aging
results.creator_credit: Peter Jordon, CRM Educational Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Examines some popular, although often mistaken, attitudes towards the aged and their places in life. Discusses two major theories: the activity theory and leisure world with Dr Vern Bengston of USC and the disengagement theory.

results.title: Ageing Parents
results.brief_description: Many children regard their parents as a burden. This thought-provoking program explores what it feels like to get older. Elderly parents, their children and teenagers talk about how they relate to each other, their expectations and ways of keeping the lines of communication open - before it’s too late.

results.title: Age of exploration: Spanish explorers
results.creator_credit: Robert H. Black and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Depicts the discovery of America, through the eyes of the Spanish explorers. Discusses Spain’s reasons for exploration and shows the conquests of Cortez, Pizarro and others in the New World.
